block.p: To the Editor: "A Toast to Breakfast" made me smile as I remembered a breakfast in a cafeteria in Budva, Yugoslavia, where we observed workers eating huge bowls of beef stew as their start-of-the day meal. When it happened, over 20 years ago, it gave us permission to rethink the concept of breakfast. Nowadays we sometimes have leftover broiled salmon, with salad, as well as other foods left from the last day or two . . . not enough for another dinner, but more than adequate for breakfast. PEARL GREENBERG New York, N.Y.
